channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Mel Gibson says his home burned down in LA fires
item.description: The Oscar-winning film star criticises California Governor Gavin Newsom over the wildfires raging in LA.

item.title: Anger after fire evacuation alert sent in error to millions in LA
item.description: As many as 10 million residents of LA county may have received the text message warning them to get ready to flee.

item.title: Trump says meeting with Putin being arranged
item.description: The US president-elect has said previously that he wants to negotiate an end to the war in Ukraine.

item.title: In Los Angeles, people snap up air filters and wear masks against smoke pollution
After 17 years, it's Hoda Kotb's last 'Today' show
item.description: Craig Melvin, current news anchor and host of Today's 3rd Hour, has been named Kotb's successor.

item.title: Trump to be sentenced for New York "hush money" crimes, a historic first
item.description: Trump was found guilty in May of 34 felonies in authorizing a scheme in 2017 to falsify records in order to cover up reimbursements for a "hush money"...

item.title: 10 people have now died in the wildfires spreading across Southern California
item.description: The number of dead tied to the wildfires increases as local officials warn the toll will increase. About 180,000 people have had to evacuate.

item.title: Maps and pictures chart how fires have spread
item.description: Maps and images showing how the fires currently affecting the Los Angeles area are developing.

item.title: Hey, meat eaters. Your gut health can rival a vegan's. Here's how
item.description: Our guts are home to trillions of microbes that influence our health. A new study finds the key to a healthy microbiome is the variety of plant-based ...

item.title: Questions over attack linger as New Orleans brings in security expert
item.description: New Orleans is facing lawsuits and investigations surrounding its safety barriers as the Super Bowl and dozens of Mardi Gras parades loom.

item.title: LA area’s 2 biggest blazes burn at least 10,000 structures, while new fire leads to more evacuations
item.description: Officials say the two biggest wildfires ravaging the Los Angeles area this week have burned at least 10,000 homes, buildings and other structures.

item.title: Jimmy Carter is no saint in my house
item.description: For President Biden's legacy, we should look to late President Jimmy Carter's history in Central America.

item.title: Woman reportedly wounds 8 in hammer attack at university in Tokyo
item.description: Japanese media say a sociology student attacked her classmates with a hammer during class after voicing frustration at being ignored.

item.title: Appeals court won't block partial release of special counsel's Trump report
item.description: Special counsel Jack Smith submitted his final report on his investigations into President-elect Donald Trump to Attorney General Merrick Garland on T...

item.title: How these suburban moms in Ukraine manage grief by training to down Russian drones
item.description: Women from a Kyiv suburb traumatized by a 2022 massacre by Russian troops joined a volunteer air defense unit to take down Russia's drones — and deal ...

item.title: Many Americans are leaving U.S. states with abortion bans, study finds
item.description: Abortion bans enacted since Roe v. Wade was overturned may be driving Americans to leave restrictive states, researchers find.

item.title: What ignited the deadly California wildfires?
Before and after images of LA buildings compared
item.description: BBC Breakfast's Charlie Stayt compares before and after pictures of the city showing the scale of the LA fires.
